item.title: Make random drops for barrow brothers? #################
item.dc:creator: @Fir3_Flam3 Fir3 Flam3
item.description:
@Fir3_Flam3 wrote:

[code]Okay, open up your NPCHandler.java and your Item2.java.

Find this in your NPCHandler.java:

public void MonsterDropItem(int NPCID)

Scroll down slightly and you will see something like:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1859) { ItemHandler.addItem(6529, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 10000000, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

This is what is going to tell the server what NPC will drop what.

Now below the last } put this:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) // ??? { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.random???(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

Replace the #### with the NPC ID of your monster, then replace both of the ??? with the monster’s name. For the second ??? make sure you remember all the cases of the letters, so put Item2.randomDharok or Item2.randomdharok.

Repeat this for all six barrows brothers.

Now go in your Item2.java then look for:

return fish[(int)(Math.random()*fish.length)];

Then below the } put this:

[code]public static int ???[] = {$$$,$$$,$$$,$$$};

public static int random???()
{
	return ???[(int)(Math.random()*???.length)];
}[/code]

Replace the four ??? with the name of the monster. If you put Item2.randomDharok in the previous bit, put Dharok in these ???. If you put Item2.randomdharok, but dharok in the ???.

Replace the $$$ with the Item IDs of the four pieces of barrows armour of that brother. Repeat this for the other five brothers.

Ask me any questions if you’re not sure.[/code]
